## MaterialBlueprintIR class

Material Blueprint Intermediate Representation

**Signature:**

```typescript
declare class MaterialBlueprintIR 
```

## Remarks

The IR is a compiled representation of the material node graph that can be efficiently translated to shader code. It performs: - Type checking and validation - Expression optimization (common subexpression elimination via reference counting) - Uniform extraction (constants become shader uniforms) - Dependency analysis (determines required vertex attributes)

The compilation process: 1. Traverse the DAG in topological order 2. Build an IR expression tree 3. Track uniforms and behaviors 4. Generate optimized shader code from the IR

## Example


```typescript
const ir = new MaterialBlueprintIR(dag, materialHash);
if (ir.ok) {
  // Generate shader code
  const outputs = ir.create(programBuilder);

  // Apply uniforms at runtime
  for (const uniform of ir.uniformValues) {
    material.setUniform(uniform.name, uniform.value);
  }
}
```
